description: Ms. codex. Title from colophon (fol. 138b). Physical description: 26 lines per page. Written in small to medium small naskh in black ink. Dark cream paper, glossy, with laid lines visible. Ḥāshiyah on the margin. Majority of quaternions; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Foliation in Arabic numerals. Stained with humidity. Two spine labels. One with title in Arabic script, reading : "Tafsīr Jawāmiʻ al-jāmiʻ j 1", the other with inscription in Roman script, reading: "Y27 1" (repeated on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover). Origin: According to colophon, copy completed during the last night (salkh) of Dhū al-Ḥijjah 743 [May 1343] (fol. 138b). Incipit: بسم ... الحمد لله الذى اكرمنا بكتابه الكريم ومن علينا بالسبع المثانى والقران العظيم ... اما بعد فانى لما فرغت من كتابى الكبير فى التفسير الموسوم بجامع البيان Explicit: ان الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات الى ولا يُشرك بعبادة ربّه احدًا الحول التحوّل يقال حال ... الكهف عند النوم الا تيقظ الساعة التى يريدها
author: Ṭabarsī, al-Faḍl ibn al-Ḥasan, -1153
abstract: First volume of a commentary on the Qurʼān, comprising the text up to the end of Sūrah 18.
extent: i, 138, i leaves: paper ; 255 x 198 (160 x 130) mm. bound to 260 x 200 mm.
title: al-Mujallad al-awwal min Jawāmiʻ al-jāmiʻ
uniform_title: جوامع الجامع في تفسير القرآن المجيد
provenance: The book was given by Abū al-Ḥasan Ḥrr(?) ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥasanī al-Wāʻiẓ to Rūḥ al-Dīn Bāqir, 13 Jumādá al-Ūlá 961 (fol. 1a). Impression of a small square seal in red ink on fol. 1a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: طبرسي، الفضل بن الحسن
subject: Qurʼan—Commentaries—History—12th century—Sources
binding_note: Bound in dark blue-green leather. Outer border in fillets.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
